wobani.resources

Class LoadableResourceMetaData

  • java.lang.Object
    • wobani.resources.LoadableResourceMetaData

  • public class LoadableResourceMetaData
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores meta data for loadable resources like it's paths or it's size.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int dataSize
      The stored resource's size in bytes.
      protected ResourceManager.ResourceState dataStorePolicy
      The resource's data store policy.
      private long lastActive
      Time in miliseconds when the resource last time used.
      private java.util.List<java.io.File> paths
      Resource's paths.
      private long ramTimeLimit
      If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is HDD, the resource's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM.
      private ResourceManager.ResourceState state
      Determines where the resource is currently stored.
      private long vramTimeLimit
      If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the resource's data may be removed from ACTION.

    • Field Detail

      • dataStorePolicy

        protected ResourceManager.ResourceState dataStorePolicy
        The resource's data store policy. ACTION means that the resource's data will be stored in VRAM the VRAM or in the sound system, ready to use. RAM means that the resource's data may be removed from ACTION to RAM if it's rarely used. HDD means that the resource's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM if it's rarely used.

      • state

        private ResourceManager.ResourceState state
        Determines where the resource is currently stored.

      • paths

        private final java.util.List<java.io.File> paths
        Resource's paths.

      • lastActive

        private long lastActive
        Time in miliseconds when the resource last time used.

      • vramTimeLimit

        private long vramTimeLimit
        If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the resource's data may be removed from ACTION.

      • ramTimeLimit

        private long ramTimeLimit
        If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is HDD, the resource's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM.

      • dataSize

        private int dataSize
        The stored resource's size in bytes.

        public void setDataSize(int size)
        Sets the resource's data size to the given value.
        Parameters:
        size - data size (in bytes)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - size can't be negative

      • getState

        @Nullable
public ResourceManager.ResourceState getState()
        Returns the resource's state. It determines where the resource is currently stored.
        Returns:
        the resource's state

      • setState

        public void setState(@NotNull
                     ResourceManager.ResourceState rs)
        Sets the resource's state to the given value.
        Parameters:
        rs - state
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - parameter can't be null

      • getDataStorePolicy

        @Nullable
public ResourceManager.ResourceState getDataStorePolicy()
        Returns the resource's data store policy. ACTION means that the resource's data will be stored in VRAM or in the sound system, ready to use. RAM means that the resource's data may be removed from ACTION to RAM if it's rarely used. HDD means that the resource's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM if it's rarely used.
        Returns:
        the resource's data store policy

      • setDataStorePolicy

        public void setDataStorePolicy(@NotNull
                               ResourceManager.ResourceState rs)
        Sets the resource's data store policy to the given value.
        Parameters:
        rs - data store policy
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - parameter can't be null

      • getActionTimeLimit

        public long getActionTimeLimit()
        Returns the ACTION time limit. If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the resource's data may be removed from ACTION.
        Returns:
        VRAM time limit (in miliseconds)

      • setActionTimeLimit

        public void setActionTimeLimit(long actionTimeLimit)
        Sets the ACTION time limit to the given value. If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the resource's data may be removed from ACTION.
        Parameters:
        actionTimeLimit - ACTION time limit (in miliseconds)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - ACTION time limit have to be higher than 0 and lower than RAM time limit

      • getRamTimeLimit

        public long getRamTimeLimit()
        Returns the RAM time limit. If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is HDD, the resource's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM.
        Returns:
        RAM time limit (in miliseconds)

      • setRamTimeLimit

        public void setRamTimeLimit(long ramTimeLimit)
        Sets the RAM time limit to the given value. If the elapsed time since this resource's last use is higher than this value and the resource's data store policy is HDD, the resource's data may be removed from ACTION or even from RAM.
        Parameters:
        ramTimeLimit - RAM time limit (in miliseconds)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - RAM time limit have to be higher than ACTION time limit
